message.text: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection').

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in data from an argument, that is intended
 to contain parameters for an 'ls' command. The test does not perform
 checks for special characters, however, and it is possible to include
 other, unexpected commands as part of the ls parameter set.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lenya
 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: ARRAY
 - Data Flow: BASIC
 - Control Flow: BREAK_WITH_LABEL

taxa.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

message.text: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection').

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in data from an argument, that is intended to contain parameters for an 'find' command. The test does not perform checks on the parameters, however, and it is possible to include other, unexpected commands as part of the find parameter set.

Metadata
-Base program: Elastic Search
- Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
- Data Type: void_pointer
- Data Flow: address_as_function_return_value
- Control Flow: function_invocation_overload

taxa.name: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')

message.text: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection').

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test creates a connection to the MySQL database,
 and creates a query string based on data in an array passed
 by arguments. This data is not checked for special elements, however,
 and it is possible to construct a query string that performs
 unexpected data retrievals or modifications.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lucene
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: INDEX_ALIAS_1
 - Control Flow: SEQUENCE

taxa.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

message.text: SQL Injection: Hibernate.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
Using Hibernate to execute a dynamic SQL statement with built-in user-controlled input can allow an attacker to modify the statement's meaning or to execute arbitrary SQL commands.

Metadata
-Base program: Apache Lenya
- Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
- Data Type: simple
- Data Flow: address_as_function_return_value
- Control Flow: interclass_50

taxa.name: SQL Injection: Hibernate

message.text: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection').

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test creates a connection to the PGSQL database,
 and creates a query string based on data in an environment
 variable. This data is not checked for special elements, however, and
 it is possible to construct a query string that performs unexpected
 data retrievals or modifications.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lenya
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: VAR_ARG_LIST
 - Control Flow: BREAK_WITH_LABEL

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test creates a connection to the MySQL database,
 and creates a query string based on data in an array passed
 by arguments. This data is not checked for special elements, however,
 and it is possible to construct a query string that performs
 unexpected data retrievals or modifications.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Jena
 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: JAVA_GENERICS
 - Control Flow: INDIRECTLY_RECURSIVE

taxa.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

message.text: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection').

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in data from an argument, that is intended
 to contain parameters for an 'ls' command. The test does not perform
 checks for special characters, however, and it is possible to include
 other, unexpected commands as part of the ls parameter set.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache POI
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: BASIC
 - Control Flow: INFINITE_LOOP

taxa.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

message.text: SQL Injection: Hibernate.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
Using Hibernate to execute a dynamic SQL statement
 with built-in user-controlled input can allow an attacker to
 modify the statement's meaning or to execute arbitrary SQL commands.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Jena
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: INDEX_ALIAS_1
 - Control Flow: BREAK_WITH_LABEL

taxa.name: SQL Injection: Hibernate

message.text: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection').

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test creates a connection to the PGSQL database,
 and creates a query string based on data in an environment
 variable. This data is not checked for special elements, however, and
 it is possible to construct a query string that performs unexpected
 data retrievals or modifications.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache POI
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: ARRAY
 - Data Flow: INDEX_ALIAS_1
 - Control Flow: INTERUPT_CONTINUE

taxa.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
